meanings.definition: Scrooges - plural noun: mean or miserly people
meanings.sent1: The scrooges in the story refused to share their wealth with others.
meanings.sent2: My neighbors are such scrooges; they never contribute to community events.
meanings.sent3: The scrooges at the office always hoard the office supplies.
meanings.sent4: Her boss was a scrooge, always counting every penny spent by the company.
meanings.sent5: The scrooges in the movie were depicted as heartless and greedy individuals.

meanings.definition: Scrooges - verb: to act in a stingy or selfish manner
meanings.sent1: Don't scrooges your time; go out and have fun!
meanings.sent2: She always scrooges when it comes to sharing her snacks with others.
meanings.sent3: He scrooges his compliments, making others feel unappreciated.
meanings.sent4: The company scrooges on employee benefits, causing dissatisfaction among workers.
meanings.sent5: The child scrooges his toys, never wanting to share with his siblings.
